body.name: Phone Tripod, MOUNTDOG Portable Webcam Stand Mini Tripod Phone Holder, Extendable Tabletop Tripod Desktop Tripod Legs Compatible with iPhone/Camera/Samsung/Smartphone/Webcam, 360° Rotation, Black

Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 10 hrs 41 mins
features: 【Safety and anti-skid design】The cell phone tripod adopts the latest anti-skid material, which makes the tripod legs more stable and not easy to slide.
【Wide compatibility】Universal interface with 1/4" mount bolt allows a variety of cameras to be mounted, the universal clip is compatible with phones of 56mm~88mm（2.2"~3.45"） width.
【Multi-Angle shots】With 360° rotation allows adjustment for multi-angle shots, you could rotate the tripod to different angles to get the any angle photos.
【Lightweight and portable】The extendable phone tripod weighs only 100g（3.5oz） and is only 16cm （4.8in） long when folded. Easy to fold and take with you anywhere.

【WARRANTY & CUSTOMER SERVICE】We offer a worry-free after-sale service for 12-month and friendly customer service since the date of purchase. Non-human damage will receive a free return and exchange service. Package includes:1 x Flexible Tripod 1 x Universal Clip 1 x User Manual

Universal Phone Mount Mobile phone mount fit devices with width from 2.2 - 3.45 inches, which are Compatible With iPhone Samsung and most smartphone. Anti-skid design The bottom is made of anti-skid rubber，ensure your phone and camera are safe to use Standard ¼ inch screw threads 1/4 Universal Screw, fits almost all entry-lever DLSR and small digital camera, webcam, projector, etc. Lightweight and portable Weight is only 100g/3.5oz, easily put in your pocket or bag. Take it when you travel, help you capture wonderful moment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It gets the job done!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I was in need of a new mini tripod and this one definitely fits the bill. It is much more sturdy than my last one. Affordable, very easy to use, doesn't take up space on your desk and fits easily in your bag, purse or pocket. I use it for YouTube videos and selfies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super-handy little tripod for WFH and travel.
reviews.reviewText: For the cost, this is a remarkable little gadget to keep in your bag, tech pouch, etc. It folds up perfectly and has proven to be incredibly stable thus far (even with a larger phone like the iPhone 12 Pro Max).WISHLIST: I only wish it could [a] extend a little higher to accommodate a standing position on a standing desk, [b] pivot forward as well as backward, and [c] feature an easier push-button release to 'grab' and 'release' the phone — similar to some phone car mounts that are out there.BTW, I almost missed out on its ability to pivot backward because I was afraid I was going to break something. It does do that well — see accompanying pictures. Not sure what angle it is though.Again, great purchase. I *highly* recommend it for quick video calls at your desk, vlogging, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Simple For Stagnant Needs
reviews.reviewText: This tripod works for what I needed, which was zoom calls from my desk. But, foe anything beyond that it would be a challenge. A few things that could be better are:1. Sturdiness - the legs are thin and take work to get the stand set up, especially with the weight of the phone and case. I worry if I touch the phone once it’s propped, it will fall.- But that sleek design is what makes it more compact and it folds up very fast. Easy to store in a purse or even wristlet.2. It doesn’t extend at all. Which is find for my needs. But, due to the sturdiness issue it would be hard to prop it up on things as well. The surface has to be leveled.- On a positive note, it swivels and the clamp holds the phone tightly.It’s a good tripod and well made, but if you’re needing something more sturdy or for lots of repositioning, this wouldn’t be the one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this Tripod!! Honest Review!!
reviews.reviewText: I needed just a simple tripod to go on my desk on the counter to hold my phone upright and this checked all the boxes. You can have it landscape vertical it goes up and down and the folds up super small and compact. It's perfect for filming videos, watching videos on my phone, having facetime calls. It's easy to throw in my purse and car to take on the go. I have used it actually a lot more than I thought and have really liked just having a stand for my phone! I have used this product for a few weeks now and really like it! Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stand Out Stand
reviews.reviewText: I use this for web meetings on my phone and it's just the right tool for that. I can't speak to using it as a selfie stick, though by inspection, I'll wager it would be okay. Really, I think this is best as a tripod.I have a thicker and heavier phone that most because I use an extended battery pack (Motorola moto Z4 with the Turbo Power battery pack) and a bumper guard. The grip wings hold the phone well and the tilt doesn't slip.Some others have remarked that the unit breaks when it is extended. As with anything you get, it you are rough with it, it will break. Extending the stand easily, but firmly, is the best way to set it up for use.I don't think it is a solution for everything, but as a desk stand for a phone or a small tripod for a camera, it's a fine tool.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Fairly sturdy and does the job. But has some quirks
reviews.reviewText: At first, this tripod made me angry because it came folded up and for some reason, mine was incredibly stiff and difficult to unfold. I actually broke my nail from opening the phone holder part.I also don’t like that it doesn’t angle. So you have to adjust yourself and the height of the phone on this device to get yourself in view.This tripod does not like phone cases. Especially not if you have a larger iPhone version. Super pain that I have to take my case off every time to use this.For such a small and simple tripod, this should not have made me as frustrated as it did.Now the upside is, I like the adjustable height and once my phone case is off, this thing works great and fairly sturdy.I do still have a bit of an issue when it’s folded up. Maybe I got one that’s difficult to open or something. I can’t imagine every reviewer had this same experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great addition to the selfie craze!
reviews.reviewText: This is a handy little tripod to keep with you for some on the spot picture taking selfies. It folds up to a short little tube and it is easy to open and set up. I have an iPhone 12 Pro and it fits ok in this, although it really is better built for the smaller phone. It isn't heavy to carry with you and quick to use. I use my watch as a remote shutter and its a breeze! Worth it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Text in meetings! Where has this been my whole remote/zoom meeting life?
reviews.reviewText: This little phone holder is the PERFECT size to hide my phone under my camera and avoid the obvious looking down at my phone while on zoom meetings. My gaze barely shifts from the camera and I can message away to my heart's content! Sturdy too!
